review: This is a great concept but it's not ready for primetime. The hardware has too many issues. I can stream Prime movies from my laptop with no problems at all, but when I use the FireStick it has to buffer about every minute and then eventually says that there is no network connection. I know it has to be the device because everything else works throughout my house perfectly for streaming: Windows 7 desktop, Apple TV, Macbook Pro, Motorola Moto G, iPad Air, KindleFire etc. This is the only device that doesn't stream. The problem is probably with data throughput due to encryption processing. The FireStick is 6ft line of sight from the router and there are no walls or other obstructions. No other devices were hitting the network at the time either. It will stream movies that are old and no one is going to steal so they require no encryption thus encryption handling seems most likely. Hopefully they'll have a solution soon.
